summary: PRRS virus (PRRSV) is a member of a group of enveloped RNA viruses from the genus Arteriviridae within the order Nidovirales. PRRSV genome is a linear, non-segmented, single stranded, positive-sense RNA with 15 kb in size [4], capped at the 5′ end and polyadenylated at the 3′ terminus. a number of newly isolated PRRSV variants with different deletions or recombinants was reported in china. the HP-PRRSV variant continues prevailing and accelerating evolution in china. reverse genetics systems developed for the study of many of the positive-stranded RNA viruses can generate recombinant mutant viruses to study different aspects of virus biology. a recombinant PRRSV expressing GFP gene proved the stability of the foreign GFP gene even after 37 serial passages. this was done by using the transcription regulatory sequence of gene 2 (TRS2) to drive transcription of the GFP gene and inserting an extra synthetic TRS6 to drive transcription of the ORF 2a and 2b. this recombinant virus stably expresses EGFP as a separate transcription unit. the pBeloBAC11 plasmid includes the first 758 nucleotides (nts) of the SD16/TRS6-EGFP and wt HP-PRRSV/SD16 infections of Marc-145 cells at 48 h pi. the antiserum neutralised both rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP and wt HP-PRRSV/SD16 virus infection. the negative serum did not neutralise the virus infection. the production of rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP and wt HP-PRRSV infectious progeny was greatly reduced by CsA at the concentrations of 2 M to 8 M in a dose dependent manner. the effect of CsA on the production of the viral proteins was evaluated by the Western blot. the recombinant rHP-PRRSV/SD16 and rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP were recovered in 60–80% of Marc-145 cells transfected using the optimal ratios of plasmid and transfection reagent. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP was used in the following experiments since it can be used for evaluating or optimizing the reverse genetics system. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP was propagated and assessed by monitoring EGFP expression in Marc-145 cells for 10 passages. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP was propagated and assessed by monitoring EGFP expression in cells for 10 passages. intracellular RNA was isolated after infection with viruses from passages 5 and 10 (P5 and P10, respectively) rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP was stable and its growth kinetics were similar to those of the parental virus. photomicrographs of 10 different positions were captured every 15 min from 1 h pi for a period of 3 days. individual infected cells expressing EGFP were observed at about 10 h pi and EGFP expression in neighbouring cells was detected between 10 and 11 h later. EGFP expression in surrounding cells was detected as late as 24 h pi in some infectious positions. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP and HP-PRRSV/SD16 viruses were incubated with serial dilutions of either a HP-PRRSV/SD16 antiserum or a negative serum. each serum dilution was tested in triplicate. CsA at various concentrations inhibited rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP and wt HP-PRRSV/SD16 infection of Marc-145 cells. the effects of CsA at various concentrations on cell viability compared to the viability of untreated control cells (100%). extra cassette can be inserted just before ORF1ab or after ORF7 regions. insertion could block early translation of pp1a and pp1ab. recombinant PRRSV including a foreign HA tag fused to ORF7 lost epitope at passage 2. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP was introduced into the HP-PRRSV/SD16 genome with limited modification of the genome. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP stably expressed EGFP as a separate transcription unit. cDNA infectious clone represents a useful tool for construction of potential recombinant vaccine candidates. early detection of infected cells showed that EGFP was expressed in cells with no apparent CPE. this could be due to high expression levels associated with genes located close to the genome end. rHP-PRRSV/SD16/TRS6-EGFP was found to be an excellent tool for screening neutralising antibodies. authors declare that they have no competing interests. authors' contributions CBW, BCH, and EMZ carried out all the experiments and drafted the manuscript.
